parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions Elena Lasconi, a candidate for the presidential elections, and other candidates,  Mihail Neamțu and Samuel Zărnescu.  It also refers to Ilie Bolojan, although not as a candidate in this specific context.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The language used and the overall message are aimed at a broad segment of the population in Bihor, Romania, not a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to dissuade voters from supporting Elena Lasconi and encourage them to vote for Mihail Neamțu and Samuel Zărnescu instead.  The post uses strong negative language towards Lasconi and frames her candidacy as a threat to Christian values. This clearly aims to influence the voting behavior of the target audience.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post cites a news article, it does not present a balanced or objective analysis.  Instead, it uses the cited article to support a strongly opinionated and partisan argument against Elena Lasconi. The tone and language are far from neutral and journalistic.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While presented as a personal opinion, the post goes beyond expressing a viewpoint. It actively advocates against a specific candidate and promotes others, making it a form of electoral propaganda.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>889601543286900</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Peter Costea, clearly constitutes electoral propaganda. It directly refers to specific candidates (Elena Lasconi, Mihail Neamțu, Samuel Zărnescu), expresses a strong opinion intended to influence voters against Lasconi and in favor of the other two, and targets a wide audience in Bihor County. The post's language is highly charged and partisan, going beyond simple commentary or opinion.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement further strengthens the case for it being electoral propaganda.  The post's reach, exceeding 1 million people, amplifies its potential impact on the election.  The timing of the post, after the official campaign period, is also a relevant factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Elena Lasconi</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Mihail Neamțu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Samuel Zărnescu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Peter Costea, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID 889601543286900), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care constituie propagandă electorală, având ca efect influențarea votului împotriva candidatei Elena Lasconi și în favoarea candidaților Mihail Neamțu și Samuel Zărnescu. Postarea, cu o estimare a audienței de peste 1 milion de persoane, conține afirmații negative și tendențioase la adresa Elenei Lasconi, prezentând-o ca o amenințare la adresa valorilor creștine și asociind-o cu secularismul și neo-marxismul.  Această postare, finanțată cu o sumă sub 100 RON,  încalcă prevederile legale prin continuarea propagandei electorale după încheierea perioadei legale și prin influențarea directă a votului,  folosind un limbaj emoțional și manipulativ,  în detrimentul Elenei Lasconi și în beneficiul candidaților Mihail Neamțu și Samuel Zărnescu.  Datele de contact ale lui Peter Costea sunt disponibile în Ad Library: davidmondoc@gmail.com și +40741900294.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
